'''Laethärn''' is a character in {{poe2}}.  

## Background

Laethärn is a leader of the [Children of the Dawnstars](/childrenOfTheDawnstars/) in the [Deadfire Archipelago](/deadfireArchipelago/). He was part of a group hired by Fleet Master Kō to tend the fields on [Hasongo](/hasongo/). Like many Dawnstars, he recently suffers vivid (sometimes prophetic) dreams and seeks to understand their meaning. 

## Interactions

{{Interactions
|companion       =
|wares           =
|stronghold      =
|rest            =
|quests_started  =
|quests_involved = 
|none            = 
|other           =Laethärn is encountered in a scripted interaction while traveling through Neketaka after completing [A Distant Light](/aDistantLight/).
}}

## =Other interactions

=
The Watcher's interaction with him determines the future of the Dawnstars. You can either strengthen his faith or convince him the Dawnstars can forge a path without it, or let him decide for himself. This will be reflected in the end-game slides.
<!-- n_Laetharn_Sway -->
{| class="wikitable sortable"
|-
!class=unsortable|Dialogue
! Ending
|-
| → "I can't tell you how to respond. You have to figure this out for yourself."
| Random
|-
| → "Don't rely on custom to drive your faith. Or you'll make the same mistakes as before."
| Faith weakened
|-
| → "I don't know what it means, but I trust there's a higher purpose to the gods' actions - including Eothas."
| Faith strengthened
|-
| → "Even gods must answer for their crimes. Eothas is no exception."
| Faith weakened
|-
| → "The gods aren't the only means to greater understanding. Together, kith can achieve much - just look at animancy."
| Faith weakened
|-
| → "Your faith and your way of life has kept your people together through war and famine. Hold onto them."
| Faith strengthened
|-
| → "The Dawnstars have survived because of the community they formed. You don't need Eothas for that."
| Faith weakened
|-
| → "I told you to leave me out of this! It's not my problem."
| Random
|}
